instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Arrived with minor liquid damage on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR> was severely burned. Replaced <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR> then discovered <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> was getting very hot and replaced that as well.

When turned on power board is power cycling. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_INSIS</SIGNAL> is steady 8.60V

Vcore pulses to 1.6V every few seconds.

What should be checked next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Very likely CPU killed by overvoltage...
